Reviews: Nice and fast could use a little more ram. The only things I real don't like is that you can only top off the ram to 12gb. Nice big screen though and it has a very fast 6 core  processor that's one reason I bought it. Doesn't come with a bunch of bloat ware either. In the description it doesn't tell you but it has biometric login which is nice. Would like to wipe it and run Linux on it  I grown used to Linux  but I don't want to get rid of a licensed copy of Widows. When you first start it up you will have the option to keep Windows 10 or upgrade to windows 11.

Reviews: I've had this laptop for a few days and I like everything about it so far. Nice big screen, privacy shutter for the camera and lots of power for the money. It's worked flawlessly so far. There was not a lot of bloatware which was also a plus. This is not a gaming laptop but it does the job for doing business and surfing the web. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase.

Product_name: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14 Laptop, Intel Core i3-1005G1, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage, 14.0" FHD Display, Windows 10 S

Review_Title: Not sure how you beat this for the price
Reviews: Wanted a new laptop with large screen but didn't want to spend a lot. This Lenovo 17.3" has met or exceeded all my expectations. You get a six core/12 thread processor, 500 gb m.2 hard drive, 8 gb mem, and a thin/sleek well made laptop for a great price.The display is TN, but colors look great and the 1600x900 resolution (for me) is perfect for this size screen. The processor is fast and runs cool. Not a gaming laptop because of integrated graphics, but for everything else this laptop suits all needs well.
Product_name: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14 Laptop, Intel Core i3-1005G1, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage, 14.0" FHD Display, Windows 10 S

Review_Title: Good Laptop For Work + Casual Gaming
Reviews: Just received the laptop today and had no noticable problems with the laptop itself.Starting up the laptop and after setting everything up I had no issues.Edit: After about 3 months of usage, I still have a good feeling about this laptop.One thing I would like to mention is the RAM. I am a Comp Sci student and one of the software I needed for my course was very RAM heavy (Android Studio is anyone is interested). The 8GB of RAM mentioned is true however you will only get to use about 6GB. This is because the hardware reserves 2GB of ram to actually run the laptop (I think?). In summary, if you are going to be using RAM heavy software, I would recommend going for a 16GB laptop instead (which was my mistake, sadly).
Product_name: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14 Laptop, Intel Core i3-1005G1, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage, 14.0" FHD Display, Windows 10 S

Review_Title: Haven't found finger print reader yet but as being expected
Reviews: Liked the product. Have not used the camera and fingerprint reader yet. Will try it and give feedback later.
Product_name: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14 Laptop, Intel Core i3-1005G1, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage, 14.0" FHD Display, Windows 10 S

Review_Title: Mouse Pad Barely Functions Keyboard not Ergonomic
Reviews: I have been using this for about 3 weeks and the mouse is difficult to control. It goes all over the place causing me to lose what I spend time typing. This is NOT a touchscreen model and it comes loaded with so much crappy nonsense and advertisements that pop up prompting tp buy stuff I don't need. The keyboard is also not ergonomic and comfortable to use, slowing the typing process. the wireless network adapter is faulty as well. I bought this to replace a crappy Gateway laptop that had the same problems with the network adapter. It is no better than the $200 Gateway. A waste if you ask me. I have to use an ethernet cable with an adapter than ended up costing me extra
Product_name: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 14 Laptop, Intel Core i3-1005G1, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage, 14.0" FHD Display, Windows 10 S

Review_Title: Great little laptop for the money
Reviews: I take this everywhere and love it. I use it for streaming and light office work. Good screen and keys feel good to the touch.. Nice long lasting battery time.

Reviews: Overall this is a good computer for your home office.  The only issue is that the video and sound are not great.  I had the previous generation of the Lenovo Ideapad and the sound and video quality was much better, so I'm not sure what went wrong on this model.  Aside from that, it's great for basic internet access, getting work done at home, and listening to music either through headphones or with separate computer speakers.

If the display matters at all to you take a pass on this one.Note: for any Linux folks it runs Arch with a 5.16 kernel with no problems at all.
